<H2>JavaOne Grande Vision I</H2>
<BR></UL></P>
<P><UL>
<LI><H2>We learnt from the Keynote talks that:
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Parallel Computing (use of multiple CPU’s to address a single problem) is inevitable
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>Year 2005, 100’s of Java CPU’s per chip to support immersive environments
<LI>Simulations of physical world (weathe, aircraft, oil resevoir, cosmology) underlie virtual worlds
</UL></UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Today’s supercomputer is a window to capabilities of tomorrow’s desktop 
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>We will see by 2005, One Million connected workstation’s, ?100? million connected consumer devices
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>How can they be integrated?
</UL></UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Complexity prevents scaling of large systems
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>Software and hardware
<LI>Jini provides new model of fault tolerant dynamic system integration</UL></UL></P>
